p.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

div.p: Expansion based on Service Type (ActivityDefinition) v0.1.0 (CodeSystem)

description.value: Indicates the Service Type for an ActivityDefinition. Values defined by openIMIS. Can not be extended.

p.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

div.p: Expansion based on Usage Context for Age Type (ActivityDefinition) v0.1.0 (CodeSystem)

description.value: Indicates the Usage Context for Age Type for an ActivityDefinition.

p.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

description.value: Indicates the Usage Context for Gender Type for an ActivityDefinition.

p.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

tr.td: The gender of the patient. For this context type, appropriate values can be found in the http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/administrative-gender value set.

The age of the patient. For this context type, the value could be a range that specifies the applicable ages or a code from an appropriate value set such as the MeSH value set http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-AgeGroupObservationValue.
The settings in which the artifact is intended for use. For example, admission, pre-op, etc. For example, the ActEncounterCode value set http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-ActEncounterCode.

The venue in which an artifact could be used. For example, Outpatient, Inpatient, Home, Nursing home. The code value may originate from the HL7 ServiceDeliveryLocationRoleType value set (http://terminology.hl7.org/ValueSet/v3-ServiceDeliveryLocationRoleType).

description.value: Indicates the Usage Context Type for an ActivityDefinition.

p.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

tr.td: A comprehensive term for health care provided in a healthcare facility (e.g. a practitioneraTMs office, clinic setting, or hospital) on a nonresident basis. The term ambulatory usually implies that the patient has come to the location and is not assigned to a bed. Sometimes referred to as an outpatient encounter.

A patient encounter where a patient is admitted by a hospital or equivalent facility, assigned to a location where patients generally stay at least overnight and provided with room, board, and continuous nursing service.

description.value: Indicates the Usage Context for Venue Type for an ActivityDefinition.

p.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

div.p: Expansion based on Usage Context for Workflow Type (ActivityDefinition) v0.1.0 (CodeSystem)

description.value: Indicates the Usage Context for Workflow Type for an ActivityDefinition. Values defined by openIMIS. Can not be extended.

p.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

div.p: Expansion based on Confirmation Types (Group) v0.1.0 (CodeSystem)

description.value: Indicates the confirmation type for the Group. Values defined by openIMIS. Can be extended.

p.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

div.p: Expansion based on Group Types (Group) v0.1.0 (CodeSystem)

description.value: Indicates the type of the Group. Values defined by openIMIS. Can be extended.

div.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

tr.td: A collection of buildings or other locations such as a site or a campus.
Any Building or structure. This may contain rooms, corridors, wings, etc. It might not have walls, or a roof, but is considered a defined/allocated space.
A Wing within a Building, this often contains levels, rooms and corridors.
A Ward is a section of a medical facility that may contain rooms and other types of location.
A Level in a multi-level Building/Structure.
Any corridor within a Building, that may connect rooms.
A space that is allocated as a room, it may have walls/roof etc., but does not require these.
A space that is allocated for sleeping/laying on. This is not the physical bed/trolley that may be moved about, but the space it may occupy.
A residential dwelling. Usually used to reference a location that a person/patient may reside.
A container that can store goods, equipment, medications or other items.
A defined path to travel between 2 points that has a known name.
A defined physical boundary of something, such as a flood risk zone, region, postcode

A wide scope that covers a conceptual domain, such as a Nation (Country wide community or Federal Government - e.g. Ministry of Health), Province or State (community or Government), Business (throughout the enterprise), Nation with a business scope of an agency (e.g. CDC, FDA etc.) or a Business segment (UK Pharmacy), not just an physical boundary

valueString.value: A collection of buildings or other locations such as a site or a campus.
Any Building or structure. This may contain rooms, corridors, wings, etc. It might not have walls, or a roof, but is considered a defined/allocated space.
A Wing within a Building, this often contains levels, rooms and corridors.
A Ward is a section of a medical facility that may contain rooms and other types of location.
A Level in a multi-level Building/Structure.
Any corridor within a Building, that may connect rooms.
A space that is allocated as a room, it may have walls/roof etc., but does not require these.
A space that is allocated for sleeping/laying on. This is not the physical bed/trolley that may be moved about, but the space it may occupy.
A residential dwelling. Usually used to reference a location that a person/patient may reside.
A container that can store goods, equipment, medications or other items.
A defined path to travel between 2 points that has a known name.
A defined physical boundary of something, such as a flood risk zone, region, postcode

A wide scope that covers a conceptual domain, such as a Nation (Country wide community or Federal Government - e.g. Ministry of Health), Province or State (community or Government), Business (throughout the enterprise), Nation with a business scope of an agency (e.g. CDC, FDA etc.) or a Business segment (UK Pharmacy), not just an physical boundary

p.style: border: black 1px dotted; background-color: #EEEEEE; padding: 8px; margin-bottom: 8px

div.p: Expansion based on openIMIS Identifiers code system v0.1.0 (CodeSystem)

tr.td: The UUID V4 unique identifier that is generated by the openIMIS Database
The DB unique integer identifier managed by the openIMIS DB
An identifier issued by the implementer to identify an openIMIS entity

tr.td: A current marriage contract is active
No marriage contract has ever been entered
Marriage contract has been declared dissolved and inactive
